description.narrative: Output 2: By 2017, child protection service providers demonstrate strengthened and coordinated capacity to prevent and respond to child protection issues in line with national policies, standard, protocols and procedures.

mailing-address.narrative: 4-8 Rangoon Close Ward 24 P.O. Box 5051 Cantoments Accra

sector.narrative: Access to child-friendly police and justice sector services
Alternative care reform and service provision
ECD data, evidence, and knowledge generation and dissemination
Family reunification in emergencies - prevention and response
Harmful practices - planning, co-ordination and programme monitoring
Legal and policy framework related to violence, exploitation and abuse
Relief co-ordination, protection and support services
Services to prevent or respond to violence, exploitation and abuse
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Social welfare workforce systems strengthening (accreditation, staffing and supervision)
Technical assistance - Prevention and response services for violence against children
Violence, exploitation, and abuse - surveys (e.g. KAP, VACS), data analysis/research/evaluation evidence generation, synthesis, and use

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

title.narrative: Ghana United Nations Development Assistance Framework
Ghana Country Programme Document 2012-2016 Results Matrix
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 2: By 2017, child protection service providers demonstrate strengthened and coordinated capacity to prevent and respond to child protection issues in line with national policies, standard, protocols and procedures.

description.narrative: Over 1000 professional social workers, community development workers, health professional trained to improve the quality of child protection services; National Strategic Framework on Ending Child Marriage accompanied by a two-year operational plan launched. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:21/12/2017

title.narrative: Proportion of reunited children who are followed up and provided with reintegration support

baseline.value: 10% of reunified children receive post reintegration support

title.narrative: Sub national level workforce work force guidelines available and formative evaluation (social welfare and community development workers)

baseline.value: No standards, protocols and procedures for service providers/stakeholders.

target.value: 2017:Draft guidelines, tools, operational procedures and standards developed and tested

actual.value: 2017:Draft guidelines for local government officials at the district level are now available. These guidelines are very much related to child protection. The guidelines will be finalized in 2018.

title.narrative: Sub national level workforce work force guidelines available and formative evaluation (social welfare and community development workers)

baseline.value: No standards, protocols and procedures for service providers/stakeholders.

target.value: 2017:Draft guidelines, tools, operational procedures and standards developed and tested

actual.value: 2017:Draft guidelines for local government officials at the district level are now available. These guidelines are very much related to child protection. The guidelines will be finalized in 2018.

title.narrative: Sub national level workforce work force guidelines available and formative evaluation (social welfare and community development workers)

baseline.value: No standards, protocols and procedures for service providers/stakeholders.

target.value: 2017:Draft guidelines, tools, operational procedures and standards developed and tested

actual.value: 2017:Draft report has been received from consultants. Regional and National Stocktaking workshops were help. The evaluation reports provides a good analysis of the progress and lessons learnt

title.narrative: Sub national level workforce work force guidelines available and formative evaluation (social welfare and community development workers)

title.narrative: Municipalities that implement local protocols for the protection of children from violence, abuse and neglect

baseline.value: Non existence of protocols on child protection at the MMDA levels

actual.value: 2017:9 districts have included child protection related issues in their medium term plans. (Out of the 20 pilot districts)
